intro: Balduina angustifolia, commonly known as narrowleaf saltbush, is a shrub native to arid and semi-arid regions of North America. It is characterized by its small, narrow leaves that are often covered in a waxy cuticle to reduce water loss. The plant produces small, greenish flowers that are typically clustered in dense inflorescences. It is well adapted to saline and alkaline soils, making it a valuable plant for stabilizing degraded landscapes. Balduina angustifolia plays an important ecological role by providing habitat and forage for native wildlife.
